link.synopsis: A pair of private dicks (Scott Mechlowicz and Alphonso McAuley) find themselves caught up in a suspected government conspiracy when they take on an uncommon case: helping a high-class call girl fight off a sexy assassin who's already torn her pimp to pieces. But there's also the matter of bringing a sleazy U.S. senator to justice. Janet McTeer, Paz Vega and D.L. Hughley co-star in this action-comedy from director John Stockwell.
link.title: synopsis
Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
What's the Worst That Could Happen?

link.synopsis: Independent movie producer Mel Wax struggles daily to keep his life and studio going in this clever animated parody of the film business, full of crazed characters voiced by comedy veterans like show creator Bob Balaban and Michael McKean.
link.title: synopsis
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
South Park: A Very Buttery Collection
The Haunted World of El Superbeasto
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder

link.synopsis: New York society couple Brad and Caroline Sexton (Tim Allen and Kirstie Alley) find themselves targets of an IRS investigation. Running from the law, they discover a safe haven in the Amish community of Intercourse, Pa. Posing as long-lost relatives of local farmer Samuel Yoder (Jay O. Sanders), the Sextons must give up their glamorous ways in order to escape IRS agent Derek Lester (Larry Miller) in director Bryan Spicer's romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: After a chance meeting with a rock group's jinxed manager (Chris Pine), independent New Yorker Ashley (Lindsay Lohan) discovers that she's caught his bad luck like a disease. Now, her only hope of restoring her charmed existence is to stalk the band and find her man. But in the process, she ends up falling for him. Samaire Armstrong, Carlos Ponce and Bree Turner co-star in this quirky romantic comedy featuring music by British pop rockers McFly.
link.title: synopsis
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding
From Justin to Kelly: The Tale of Two American Idols
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days

link.synopsis: The joy and happiness of the holiday season is ruined for the saintly Santa Claus (Paul Giamatti) when his cranky older brother, Fred (Vince Vaughn) -- a repo man with a sizable rap sheet -- comes to stay with him at the North Pole. Kevin Spacey, Miranda Richardson, Kathy Bates and Elizabeth Banks co-star in this yuletide comedy from director David Dobkin that puts sibling rivalry in a whole new context.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother

link.synopsis: When an astronaut tapped to man the first flight to Mars is injured, NASA replaces him with hapless spacecraft designer Fred Z. Randall (Harland Williams). Teamed with a brash commander (William Sadler), a proficient mission specialist (Jessica Lundy) and a trained chimp, Randall nearly brings down the mission with his ineptitude. Beau Bridges co-stars in this zany comedy, filmed in part at the Johnson Space Center in Houston.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Little
Mom and Dad Save the World
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
The Return of the Pink Panther
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

link.synopsis: A deadly government-controlled virus strikes a small Nebraska strip club, where the head dancer is quickly infected and transformed into a flesh-eating zombie -- and becomes an instant hit with the customers. To be or not to be a zombie: That is the question facing the remaining jealous strippers in this outrageous horror comedy, starring slasher icon Robert Englund (best known as Freddy Krueger) and adult-entertainment icon Jenna Jameson.
link.title: synopsis
Evil Breed: The Legend of Samhain
Naked Ambition: An R-Rated Look at an X-Rated Industry

link.synopsis: Red-hot comedian Katt Williams brings his outrageous comedy to the stage in this live performance from his sold-out, 100-city 2008 tour. It's a hilarious, no-holds-barred commentary on relationships, sex, politics and more -- all raw and uncut. Pimpin' his controversial and edgy humor, Williams lampoons life's absurdities with his street thug persona and point of view that keeps audiences whooping for more.
link.title: synopsis
Katt Williams: The Pimp Chronicles: Pt. 1
Katt Williams: American Hustle: The Movie
Chocolate Sundaes Presents: Live on Sunset Strip!
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Kevin Hart: I'm a Grown Little Man
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Sold Out: A Threevening with Kevin Smith
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Guy Torry's Phat Comedy Tuesdays: Vol. 2
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Robin Harris: Live from the Comedy Act Theater
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet

link.synopsis: When college-bound "animal whisperer" Maya Dolittle (Kyla Pratt) assists movie star Tiffany Monaco's (Tegan Moss) Chihuahua, she gets sucked into the allure and flashiness of Hollywood after an impressed Tiffany offers her a plum television gig. But Maya's wisecracking mutt, Lucky, helps her hold on to her perspective -- and her true dream of becoming a veterinarian -- in this adventurous, cuddly family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Dolittle: Tail to the Chief
The Adventures of Rocky and Bullwinkle

link.synopsis: Desperate for a housekeeper, three crotchety Cape Cod sea captains and housemates decide that one of them must sacrifice his own bachelor bliss and take a mail-order bride, a woman who will cook and clean for all of them. But when the candidate bride (Mariel Hemingway) arrives, her beauty prompts each man to reconsider the virtues of married life. Rip Torn, Bruce Dern and David Carradine co-star in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: Martin Clunes stars in this updated BBC comedy (based on a popular sitcom of the 1970s) as Reginald Perrin, an executive who oversees the production of disposable razors -- and his own midlife crisis -- while working for the Groomtech company.
link.title: synopsis
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin: The Complete Series
Doc Martin and the Legend of the Cloutie
Are You Being Served? Again: The Complete Series
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Keeping Up Appearances: Life Lessons from Onslow

link.synopsis: Hapless in both life and love, Javier plunges into an emotional abyss when his new wife abandons him -- and their plan of a life together in Miami -- in this romantic comedy that follows the slightly off-kilter course of the spurned man's recovery.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
Yo Soy Boricua, Pa'Que Tu Lo Sepas!
The Other Side of the Bed
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears

link.synopsis: Terry-Thomas and Peter Sellers star in this 1950s comedy. When the king of a small Pacific island dies, the island's evil and greedy prime minister (Sellers) looks to profit from the monarch's death. But the British quickly send a diplomat, the bumbling Carlton-Browne (Thomas), to establish friendly ties with the heir to the throne -- and, more importantly, to prevent other powers from tapping into the island's potentially rich mineral deposits.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
Don't Worry, We'll Think of a Title
The Return of the Pink Panther
Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall

link.synopsis: When cutbacks threaten his high school's music program, physics teacher Scott Voss decides to moonlight as a mixed martial arts fighter in order to raise the money that would save the program.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Once Upon a Time in Mexico
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning

link.synopsis: When mob mule Lenny (Steven Bauer) goes missing with $5 million of boss Tony Thick's (Armand Assante) money, Tony sends Shady (Steve Baker) to Los Angeles to track down the cash. Once there, Shady runs into all kinds of quirky characters who are also after the money. The greedy oddballs in this crime comedy include Lenny's ex-wife (Nicole Eggert), his mistress (Whitney Able), his neurosurgeon (John Heard) and his brother, Louis (Joe Piscopo).
link.title: synopsis
The Last Days of Frankie the Fly

link.synopsis: Mollie is a single working mother who's out to find the perfect father for her child. Her baby, Mikey, prefers James, a cab driver turned babysitter who has what it takes to make them both happy. But Mollie won't even consider James. It's going to take all the tricks a baby can think of to bring them together before it's too late. Amy Heckerling wrote and directed this baby's-eye-view comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Three Men and a Little Lady
The 2006 Academy Award Short Films Collection

link.synopsis: In this mordant 1997 comedy, self-absorbed novelist Harry Block (Woody Allen) sees his literary chickens come home to roost after he pens a roman à clef that offends, enrages and alienates everyone in his orbit. The film's sterling cast also includes Elisabeth Shue as Harry's ex-girlfriend, Kirstie Alley as his former spouse, Bob Balaban as his best pal and Judy Davis as the erstwhile sister-in-law who wants to murder Harry.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: Two-time Oscar winner Tom Hanks got his big break in this raunchy comedy. Hanks plays bus driver Rick Gasko, engaged to super-rich Debbie Thompson (Tawny Kitaen). To keep an eye the groom, Debbie and her pals pose as hookers and go to his bachelor party. While the film veers into Animal House territory at times, the laughs are solid.
link.title: synopsis
The Man with One Red Shoe
Revenge of the Nerds IV: Nerds in Love
Revenge of the Nerds 2: Nerds in Paradise

link.synopsis: Miami dentist Dr. Ted Brooks (Cuba Gooding Jr.) treks to Alaska to claim an inheritance that turns out to be a team of champion sled dogs. Trouble is, old curmudgeon "Thunder" Jack Johnson (James Coburn) wants the canines for an Arctic Circle dogsledding tournament. But plans change when Thunder turns up missing, and it's up to Ted to save the day. Director Brian Levant's family-centered comedy combines flinty humor and heartfelt drama.
link.title: synopsis
Far from Home: The Adventures of Yellow Dog

link.synopsis: Sidney Poitier and Bill Cosby team up in this hilarious misadventure as buddies Steve and Wardell, who head uptown to a swanky nightclub. Unfortunately, thieves hit the club and steal Steve's wallet -- which happens to hold a winning lottery ticket. Poitier also directed this classic 1970s comedy, which co-stars Harry Belafonte as Godfather figure Geechie Dan Beauford and Richard Pryor as bumbling gumshoe Shape Eye Washington.
link.title: synopsis
Five on the Black Hand Side
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Return of the Pink Panther
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?
The Russians Are Coming, The Russians Are Coming
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

link.synopsis: "Futurama" executive producers Matt Groening ("The Simpsons") and David X. Cohen show off their best work, packing four of their favorite episodes into one  collection. Set in "New" New York in the year 3000, this clever animated comedy reveals a futuristic world with just as many hassles as the present. Episodes from the first four seasons include "Hell Is Other Robots," "Anthology of Interest," "Roswell That Ends Well" and "The Sting."
link.title: synopsis
Futurama: The Beast with a Billion Backs
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score
Family Guy: Partial Terms of Endearment
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
Robot Chicken Star Wars: Episode II
Family Guy: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
Seth MacFarlane's Cavalcade of Cartoon Comedy: Uncensored
Daria: The Movie: Is It Fall Yet?
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Family Guy Presents: Stewie Griffin: The Untold Story
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Boggy Creek II: And the Legend Continues
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonders
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Prince of Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Overdrawn at the Memory Bank
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tracy Morgan
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manos: The Hands of Fate
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Wild World of Batwoman

title.regular: Futurama: Monster Robot Maniac Fun Collection

link.synopsis: In this remake of the classic Disney comedy -- retooled for contemporary audiences -- harried attorney Dave Douglas (Tim Allen) finds himself cuddling up to his wife (Kristin Davis) and kids (Zena Grey and Spencer Breslin) in his new role as the family pet and becoming his own best friend. The supporting cast includes "Saturday Night Live" alum Jane Curtin and Robert Downey Jr., who plays an odious yuppie capitalist.
link.title: synopsis
Penguins of Madagascar: New to the  Zoo
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Free Willy 4: Escape from Pirate's Cove

link.synopsis: Unhappy with his life, mattress salesman Brian Weathersby (Paul Dano) pursues his lifelong obsession with adopting an infant from China. But when attractive customer Harriet (Zooey Deschanel) catches his eye, he starts pursuing her instead. Soon, Harriet's overbearing father (John Goodman) and Brian's parents (Ed Asner and Jane Alexander) become involved in their relationship, pushing Brian to take drastic action in this quirky romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: In his second stand-up special for HBO, recorded live in San Antonio, Texas, in August 2009, comedy superstar George Lopez mocks a handful of his favorite topics, including love, family and the quirks of Latino culture. Lopez also focuses his humor on the rising influence of Latino voters in U.S. politics, starting with an enthusiastic nod to the first Latina to be named a Supreme Court justice, Sonia Sotomayor.
link.title: synopsis
Brown Is the New Green: George Lopez and the American Dream
Paul Rodriguez's Latin All-Stars of Comedy: Vol. 1
The Original Latin Kings of Comedy
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Carlos Mencia: Not for the Easily Offended: Live in San Jose
Lisa Lampanelli: Long Live the Queen
Dana Carvey: Squatting Monkeys Tell No Lies
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Carlos Mencia: The Best of "Funny Is Funny"
Cedric the Entertainer: Taking You Higher
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live from San Jose
Lisa Lampanelli: Dirty Girl: No Protection
Lisa Lampanelli: Take It Like a Man
Cheech Marin and Friends: Live from South Beach
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 3: Launching Pad
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid

link.synopsis: A pair of World War II veterans -- Harry (David Jason) and Frank (David Warner) -- are determined to carry out the dying wish of their friend Albert, who asks to be buried at the site of a battle in Germany that still haunts them. While transporting Albert's body atop Harry's cab, the duo picks up a German hitchhiker (Judith Hoersch) who gets the old warriors to reveal their sad secret in this road film that blends dark comedy and poignant drama.
link.title: synopsis
The Boy in the Striped Pajamas
When Did You Last See Your Father?
Masterpiece Classic: Cranford: Return to Cranford

link.synopsis: In this black comedy inspired by real-life events, affable Texas mortician Bernie befriends the small town's wealthiest widow and then kills her. But despite the suspicious nature of her death, no one wants to think anything but the best of Bernie.
link.title: synopsis
The Ballad of the Sad Café
Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation
Tenacious D in: The Pick of Destiny
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Although very much of its time (the late 1960s), "Laugh-In" easily bucks modern comedy trends and remains a timeless wonder -- one that heavily influenced comedy shows that followed in its wake. Includes two full-length episodes (spanning the years 1968-71) from the vintage television comedy series.
link.title: synopsis
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2: Disc 1
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2: Disc 2
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2: Disc 3
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 3
The Best of the Flip Wilson Show
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
Sid Caesar Collection: The Buried Treasures
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!

The Best of The Johnny Cash TV Show: 1969-1971
Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour III & IV
The Pat Paulsen Half a Comedy Hour
The Best of the David Steinberg Show
Saturday Night Live: 25 Years of Music
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Graham Chapman's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Michael Palin's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best

title.regular: The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2
title.short: The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2

link.synopsis: Three students try to survive law school in this episodic indie comedy starring Josh Renfree as slacker Terry King, who only enrolled to put off facing the real world but is forced to work harder than he ever imagined. As his determined roommate, Susan Walsh (Erica Shaffer), takes ambition and organization to a new level, their glib friend Charles Johnson (Jou Jou Papailler) learns some surprising lessons working for a shifty attorney.
link.title: synopsis
A Lawyer Walks into a Bar...

link.synopsis: Topping the charts for eight weeks in 1955 with "Rock Around the Clock," Bill Haley and His Comets exploded onto the music scene. Blending rhythm and blues, honky-tonk and country boogie, Haley's band played rock 'n' roll before the genre had a moniker. This dynamic video chronicles Haley's pop-music legacy and features footage of the group performing their biggest hits, which included "Shake, Rattle and Roll" and "See You Later, Alligator."
link.title: synopsis
Doo Wop: Vocal Group Greats Live
Jazz Icons: Charles Mingus: Live in '64
The Tomorrow Show with Tom Snyder: Punk & New Wave
Bill Haley and His Comets: Live!: Birmingham Odeon 1979
Peter Noone: In Concert with the Chambers Brothers
Charlie Gracie: Fabulous! An Intimate Portrait of a Rock Pioneer
Georgie Fame and the Blue Flames: Cool Cat Blues
One for the Money: The Birth of Rock & Roll
Vocal Group Hall of Fame: Vol. 4
Lost Concerts Series: Presley & Cash: The Road Show
Let it Rock: At the Crossroads of Rock and Roll
The Platters with the Crickets & Lenny Welch
Petula Clark: At the Turn of the Year
Gerry and the Pacemakers: Live at the Pavilion Theatre Glasgow 1990
Beach Boys: Sights and Sounds of Summer
Petula Clark: Live at the Paris Olympia
Vanilla Fudge: When Two Worlds Collide
Jerry Lee Lewis: Last Man Standing Live
The Lovin' Spoonful: Do You Believe in Magic
Gene Vincent: At Town Hall Party
Eddie Cochran: At Town Hall Party

title.short: Bill Haley and His Comets: Encore Series

link.synopsis: When they released their hit single "Rock Around the Clock" in 1955, Bill Haley and his band of Comets forever changed the face of rock 'n' roll. This rare live concert captured more than 20 years later at the Birmingham Odeon showcases the band's boundless passion for performing, featuring tracks such as "Shake, Rattle and Roll," "Razzle Dazzle," "Rudy's Rock," "See You Later, Alligator," "Rock This Joint" and "Rock-A-Beatin' Boogie."
link.title: synopsis
Olivia Newton-John & the Sydney Symphony: Live at the Sydney Opera House
Groucho Marx: You Bet Your Life: The Lost Episodes

Why Has Bodhi Dharma Left for the East?
Good Rockin' Tonight: The Legacy of Sun Records

title.regular: Bill Haley and His Comets: Live!: Birmingham Odeon 1979
title.short: Bill Haley and His Comets: Live!

link.synopsis: Learning his only true friend and kindred soul -- his dwarf hamster, Etienne -- is dying of cancer, shy hotel worker Richard (Richard Vallejos) decides to show Etienne the world before he goes. Soon, the two are tooling along the California coast on Richard's bicycle. As they travel, man and hamster meet a variety of quirky individuals, make many new friends and realize some important life lessons in this charming indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Ballad of Jack and Rose
It's Kind of a Funny Story

link.synopsis: Martin Sheen and Emilio Estevez, in his film debut, star as father and son in this tense drama about a teen whose drunken joyride lands him in jail. To teach their son a lesson, his parents leave him overnight -- a decision they'll live to regret. Survival in the gritty, unforgiving jail leads to an assault charge for the teen, and days turn into weeks as his stressed family fights to get him back. Jane Alexander also stars.
link.title: synopsis
Blood Vows: The Story of a Mafia Wife
In the Arms of a Killer

link.synopsis: Years after adopting a baby, a happily married family man becomes obsessed with learning about the child's birth mother, only to discover she is a high-priced call girl in this superior late-career effort from writer, director and star Woody Allen. The comedy also stars Mira Sorvino, who won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her memorable turn as the object of Allen's infatuation, while Allen's tart screenplay also earned Academy Award honors.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

link.title: You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: After her husband drops dead on their wedding night, spoiled society girl Judy Benjamin (Goldie Hawn) decides to join the army -- a choice with consequences both explosive and explosively funny. The situation is mined (no pun intended) for plenty of laughs, but in the end, this classic comedy is about Judy's inspiring search for identity and independence. Eileen Brennan co-stars as the tough-as-nails captain determined to teach Judy a lesson.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: There's a Girl in My Soup

link.synopsis: For the Allied prisoners of Stalag 17, every escape attempt ends the same way: disaster. Cynical Sgt. Sefton (William Holden, in his Oscar-winning role) thinks they're all fools for trying -- but soon his hectoring starts raising suspicions that there's a German spy among them. Could that spy be him? Director Billy Wilder effortlessly mixes broad comedy and high-tension drama in this World War II classic.
link.title: synopsis
All Quiet on the Western Front
The Bridge on the River Kwai
The First Films of Samuel Fuller: The Steel Helmet

link.synopsis: Based on Henry Fielding's novel, this four-time Oscar winner (including Best Picture) also scores points for outrageous comedy. Orphaned as an infant and adopted by Squire Allworthy (George Devine), the devilishly handsome, womanizer Tom (Albert Finney) truly loves only one: Sophie. His adventurous attempts to woo her lead him to London, where a duel with a jealous husband lands Tom in prison, and only the secret of his birth can save his life.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
The Hammer Horror Series: Brides of Dracula / The Curse of the Werewolf
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
Why Change Your Wife? / Miss Lulu Bett

link.synopsis: When mousy art-house auctioneer Michael (Hugh Grant) proposes to his teacher girlfriend Gina (Jeanne Tripplehorn), only then does he learn Gina's father is a mobster. Michael's blundering efforts to cozy up to the &NFi;famiglia&NFi_; make for a broad comedy of errors. And things get worse when a local godfather (Burt Young) buttonholes Grant to sell his no-talent son's gory paintings via the auction house. James Caan co-stars as Gina's wise-guy dad.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Harry and Walter Go to New York
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: A hell-raising Navy test pilot (Dennis Quaid) is miniaturized for a top-secret exploratory journey inside a laboratory rabbit -- but is instead injected into the body of a high-strung nebbish (Martin Short) who works as a supermarket clerk. Co-starring Meg Ryan, Innerspace is like The Fantastic Voyage with a laugh track. Short's twitchy physical comedy is a marvel to behold.
link.title: synopsis
Back to the Future Part III
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
Journey to the Center of the Earth
Back to the Future Part II
Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home
Journey to the Center of the Earth
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country
Star Trek III: The Search for Spock

link.synopsis: Having won an all-expenses-paid trip on the game show "Pig in a Poke," the Griswolds head for Europe, and it's the usual comedy of errors as the bumbling Clark (Chevy Chase) herds his family through a foreign land. Now, after wreaking havoc across their own country, the Griswolds are taking England, France and Germany by storm. Along the way, they see Big Ben, the Parliament … Big Ben, the Parliament … and the world-famous Eiffel Tower.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
The Brady Bunch in the White House
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manos: The Hands of Fate

link.synopsis: In director Kevin Bray's action comedy, Miami-based bounty hunter Bucum Jackson (Ice Cube) corners bail-jumper Reggie White (Mike Epps) in an abandoned warehouse, which happens to be the drop zone for a gigantic diamond heist. Reggie hides from Bucum in the fleeing thieves' van -- where the latter happened to drop a lottery ticket worth $60 million. Now, the two men must join forces to outfox the thieves for both the ticket and the diamonds.
link.title: synopsis
Mike Epps: Under Rated & Never Faded
Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia

link.synopsis: This late-night HBO sketch comedy series starring funnymen Bob Odenkirk and David Cross is a breath of fresh air for those seeking big laughs, terrific ingenuity and a touch of good-natured insanity. The first season of this laugh-a-minute program  is full of quirks and oddities -- such as the sketch with the hunger striker who wanted to be buried up to his neck in mashed potatoes -- and is utterly unique.
link.title: synopsis
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Tom Goes to the Mayor: The Complete Series
The Kids in the Hall: The Pilot Episode
Dr. Katz: Professional Therapist: The Complete Series

Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey

Best of the Chris Rock Show: Vol. 1

Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tom Hanks
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jon Lovitz
The House of Venus Show: Season 1
SCTV: Best of the Early Years
Abbott and Costello Funniest Routines: Vol. 2

link.synopsis: When charming young American Isabel Walker (Kate Hudson) travels to Paris to visit her expat sister, Roxanne (Naomi Watts), she finds that Roxanne's philandering French husband has abandoned her at her eighth month of pregnancy. Isabel wants to help Roxanne untangle herself from the mess, but soon is enmeshed in her own romantic folly in this Merchant-Ivory comedy of manners based on Diane Johnson's best-selling novel of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Steven (Adrien Brody), a socially inept oddball who struggles to express himself, learns to communicate with the world through his dummy and the art of ventriloquism in this quirky comedy from writer-director Greg Pritikin. Cast against type, supermodel Milla Jovovich also stars as Steven's gauche best friend, Fangora, an aspiring Yiddish punk-folk singer, while Illeana Douglas, Jessica Walter and Ron Leibman portray Steven's exasperating family.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know
The Last Time I Committed Suicide
Smiling Fish and Goat on Fire

link.synopsis: In this domestic comedy directed by David Lean, boozy widower Henry Hobson (Charles Laughton) runs a successful boot shop in Victorian England. But he dominates his employees and his three daughters, until one challenges him. When his eldest, Maggie (Brenda De Banzie), and his assistant (John Mills) marry and set up a rival business, Hobson must change his autocratic ways. The film won a British Academy Award for Best Film.
link.title: synopsis
The Man in the White Suit
The Man on the Eiffel Tower
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
I Was a Male War Bride
Seven Brides for Seven Brothers: 50th Anniversary Edition

link.synopsis: Picking up where The Prince & Me left off, this sequel to the romantic comedy focuses on the preparations for the royal nuptials between the Danish Prince Edvard (Luke Mably) and his all-American bride-to-be, Paige (Kam Heskin, stepping into the role originally portrayed by Julia Stiles). But the wedding is threatened when the couple discovers an antiquated law that requires the prince marry a woman with royal blood -- or give up his crown.
link.title: synopsis
The Prince & Me 3: A Royal Honeymoon
From Justin to Kelly: The Tale of Two American Idols

title.regular: The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding
title.short: The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding

link.synopsis: William (Martin Clunes), a lonely undertaker looking for romance, meets Mary (Julie Graham), a midwife, through a dating service. Amid the uneasy balance of life and death involved in their jobs, their relationship experiences more than the usual ups and downs. Cheryl Campbell, Dominick Baron, Peta Cornish, Ricci McLeod and Michael Begley co-star in this acclaimed ITV series, a refreshingly unpredictable blend of comedy, drama and romance.
link.title: synopsis
Doc Martin and the Legend of the Cloutie
The Worst Week of My Life
The Five People You Meet in Heaven
Dying to Live: The Journey into a Man's Open Heart
What If God Were the Sun?
Masterpiece Classic: Cranford: Return to Cranford

link.synopsis: When an Egyptian police brass band travels to Israel to play at the opening of an Arab arts center, the group ends up abandoned and lost in a remote desert town, igniting a charming cross-cultural comedy. Defying expectations, the tiny Israeli community embraces the musicians, and both the Egyptians and the locals learn a few things about one another -- and themselves. This witty foreign-language film nabbed the Un Certain Regard prize at Cannes.
link.title: synopsis
Turn Left at the End of the World
When Did You Last See Your Father?

link.synopsis: Two scheming crooks brew up a witch hunt to steal land from the citizens of Salem, Mass., in this comedy. It's 1692, and baker Sara Lee (Kelly Preston) is thrilled to be reunited with childhood sweetheart Miles Campbell (Patrick Cassidy). But her life turns upside down when Salem's mayor (Dave Thomas) and judge (Stuart Pankin) accuse her of witchcraft, and the cauldron boils over when a shapely stranger (Barbara Carrera) arrives in town.
link.title: synopsis
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
In Search of History: Salem Witch Trials
To Be or Not To Be
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear

link.synopsis: Edgier and darker than Spinal Tap, this mockumentary follows the reunion tour of the titular punk band. Narrator Bruce McDonald trails the group from one venue to the next, adding insightful commentary about each band member along the way. McDonald also spotlights Logo's charismatic lead singer, Joe Dick (Hugh Dillon), and his self-imposed mission to hold the band together at all costs. Punk godfathers D.O.A. and Joey Ramone appear in cameos.
link.title: synopsis
Too Tough To Die: A Tribute To Johnny Ramone

link.synopsis: Bill Cosby, Harvey Keitel and Raquel Welch star in this zany 1976 comedy about two privately owned ambulance companies in intense competition for a contract with the city of Los Angeles. A mix of slapstick comedy punctuated by moments of drama, the film follows a group of unique colleagues, including an ambulance driver who drinks at the wheel, a sexy female switchboard operator and a police officer on suspension for peddling drugs to minors.
link.title: synopsis
Suppose They Gave a War and Nobody Came?

link.synopsis: A 1990s spin on a classic, director Tom Shadyac's Oscar-nominated comedy follows portly professor Sherman Klump (Eddie Murphy, who plays seven characters in the film) as he bumbles through attempts at romance. Humiliated while trying to impress grad student Carla Purty (Jada Pinkett), Sherman takes a massive dose of his new weight-loss potion. Too bad the potion has bugs: The svelte Sherman proves to be an insufferable jerk.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Nutty Professor II: The Klumps

link.synopsis: Judy Holliday reprises her Tony Award-winning role as a scatterbrained switchboard operator in Vincente Minnelli's musical comedy. The story centers on eavesdropping phone operator Ella (Holliday), who goes incognito to help her problem-plagued customers. Eventually, she wins the heart of a handsome playwright (Dean Martin), even though she'd been impersonating an old woman in their conversations. Jean Stapleton and Eddie Foy Jr. also star.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: How to Save a Marriage and Ruin Your Life / Who Was That Lady?
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: Hoping to snag some free beer by helping a brewery owner reclaim her business, goofy brothers Bob (Rick Moranis) and Doug (Dave Thomas) end up battling criminal Brewmeister Smith (Max von Sydow), who plans to take over the world by releasing his hypnotic suds to the public. Can the beer-guzzling masses count on these "hosers" to save the day? Paul Dooley and Lynne Griffin also star in this gut-busting vintage comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Who Framed Roger Rabbit?: Special Edition
The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother
So I Married an Axe Murderer
The Man with One Red Shoe

link.synopsis: Considered one of Charlie Chaplin's best films, The Kid also made a star of little Jackie Coogan, who plays a boy cared for by The Tramp when he's abandoned by his mother, Edna (Edna Purviance). Later, Edna has a change of heart and aches to be reunited with her son. When she finds him and wrests him from The Tramp, it makes for what turns out be one of the most heart-wrenching scenes ever included in a comedy. Chaplin also directs.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this screwball comedy, love-struck teenager Susan (Shirley Temple) sneaks into the apartment of playboy artist Richard Nugent (Cary Grant), where she's tracked down by her sister, Judge Margaret Turner (Myrna Loy). Threatened with prison, Nugent agrees to date Susan until her infatuation subsides. Soon, Nugent is spouting teen slang and Susan is affecting an air of sophistication. Sidney Sheldon's screenplay won a Best Writing Oscar.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
Tammy Tell Me True / Tammy and the Doctor
Thirty Day Princess / Kiss and Make Up

link.synopsis: This sidesplitting parody of British talk shows features obnoxious, tactless host Alan Partridge, a character invented and played by comedy writer Steve Coogan. Partridge is completely out of his depth as he offends guests, attempts to offer fashion tips, wrestles with half-naked men and insults the French, all the while laying waste to the talk-show medium in this hilarious series. Dominic Brigstocke directs.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
People Like Us: The Complete Series
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Hercules Against the Moon Men
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Brain That Wouldn't Die
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Wild World of Batwoman
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Teenagers from Outer Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Killer Shrews
The Best of So Graham Norton
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner

title.regular: Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
title.short: Knowing Me Knowing You: Complete Series

link.synopsis: Inspired by actual news articles, this dark comedy about a dysfunctional family and its deadly consequences -- a film bleeding with deception, sex and scandal -- is writer-director Nick Guthe's impressive first-time foray into feature filmmaking. The plot concerns Mini (Nikki Reed), who hates her materialistic mother (Carrie-Anne Moss) and uses her rich stepfather (Alec Baldwin) to teach Mom a lesson. Luke Wilson and Jeff Goldblum co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Alec Baldwin
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Twin Peaks: Fire Walk With Me

link.synopsis: Director Pedro Almodovar explores human nature's dark side in this pitch-black comedy that centers on a bullfighter (Nacho Martinez) who's forced to retire but still yearns for the thrill of the kill -- and finds it in the bedroom. Making love to a woman before spearing her is the closest thing to life in the ring -- and is elated when he meets his match in beautiful Maria (Assumpta Serna). A young Antonio Banderas plays an aspiring matador.
link.title: synopsis
What Have I Done to Deserve This?
Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!
In the Realm of the Senses
The Cook, The Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover

link.synopsis: When Freudian psychiatrist Leon (Àlex Brendemühl) vanishes, his pregnant wife, Alma (Leonor Watling), and her brother-in-law Salvador (Luis Tosar) try to uncover the mystery behind his disappearance in this intelligent comedy set in 1913 Barcelona. The film follows Alma and Salvador as they find clues in Leon's accounts of four "hysterical" female patients and then track down the subjects in an attempt to locate the missing doctor.
link.title: synopsis
De Que Se Rien Las Mujeres?
Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears
Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Two decades ago, Louis (Samuel L. Jackson) and Floyd (Bernie Mac) went their separate ways when their band broke up. But when their group's former front man dies, the two feuding singers agree to put aside their differences for a tribute concert at the Apollo Theater. The show promises to be a big hit -- if Louis and Floyd don't kill each other first. Jennifer Coolidge and Sean Hayes co-star in this road comedy from director Malcolm D. Lee.
link.title: synopsis
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
The Last of the Blonde Bombshells
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back

link.synopsis: Taking a new job to escape a bleak existence as a working-class stiff in a small English town, Freddie Taylor (Christian Cooke) gets ensconced in more drama than he bargained for when he runs into his old flame, Julie (Felicity Jones). Now Freddie and his mates, Bruce (Tom Hughes) and Snork (Jack Doolan), must navigate the consequences of the lovely lady's unexpected reappearance. Ricky Gervais and Stephen Merchant direct this inspired comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The City of Your Final Destination
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
The Good, the Bad, the Weird
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
James Patterson's Suzanne's Diary for Nicholas

link.synopsis: This iconic comedy follows the escapades of seven castaways, led by Skipper (Alan Hale Jr.) and his bumbling first mate, Gilligan (Bob Denver), after their cruise goes awry and they're stranded on a tropical isle. Will their outlandish schemes for rescue ever work? Their companions are a millionaire (Jim Backus), his ditsy wife (Natalie Schafer), a professor (Russell Johnson), a movie star (Tina Louise) and lovable Mary Ann (Dawn Wells).
link.title: synopsis
Saved by the Bell: The College Years
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Michael Palin's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
Doctor Who: Planet of the Dead
The New Adventures of Old Christine

link.synopsis: Adapted from the Australian TV series, this unconventional comedy follows the surreal experiences of Ryan, a deeply depressed man who becomes convinced that his neighbor's dog Wilfred is actually a man wearing a costume.
link.title: synopsis
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
The Vicar of Dibley: A Holy Wholly Happy Ending
The Lone Gunmen: The Complete Series
Parking Wars: The Best of Season 1
The Natural History of the Chicken
The Pat Paulsen Half a Comedy Hour

link.synopsis: Hipsters from the trendy Silverlake neighborhood of Los Angeles contend with the demands of adulthood in this woman-powered comedy. When one of them gives birth to a baby, her roomie resolves to not let this new responsibility hamper their lifestyle.
link.title: synopsis
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins

link.synopsis: In Sometimes They Come Back, a schoolteacher (Tim Matheson) beset by vengeful spirits must confront the ghosts of his past. In the 1996 sequel, psychologist Jon Porter (Michael Gross) returns home after a long absence and stays to help his town battle sinister forces. Also starring Brooke Adams and Hilary Swank, this chilling double feature is based on short stories penned by horror master Stephen King.
link.title: synopsis
A Nightmare on Elm Street 6: Freddy's Dead: The Final Nightmare
A Nightmare on Elm Street 5: The Dream Child
Friday the 13th: Part 8: Jason Takes Manhattan
A Nightmare on Elm Street 4: The Dream Master
A Nightmare on Elm Street 3: Dream Warriors

title.regular: Sometimes They Come Back / Sometimes They Come Back Again

link.synopsis: After learning his longtime girlfriend has been unfaithful, devastated Peter (Anthony Deptula) arrives at the church where his estranged high school friend, Fischer (Stephen Hale), lives in exchange for locking up at night. But he soon discovers Fischer's issues are bigger than his. As Peter and Fischer forge a new relationship and seek common ground, Peter's girlfriend (Tina Kapousis) arrives on the scene. Michael Mohan directs this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
All the Way: The Kidnapping of a Music Legend
It's Kind of a Funny Story
All My Friends Are Funeral Singers

link.synopsis: Hoping to eradicate the lawlessness plaguing the Arizona territory, newspaperman Fred Gately prints a letter asking the president to visit the area. But Fred's killed by secret gang leader Champion (Roy Barcroft), who also plans to assassinate the president. Undercover officer Rocky Lane (Allan Lane) teams with his assistant, Nugget (Eddy Waller), and Fred's spunky daughter (Kay Christopher) to combat Champion's head gunslinger (Lane Bradford).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Years in prison haven't erased Justin Gatewood's (Mark Redfield) quest for vengeance in this action-packed Western set in the post-Civil War era. Now that he's free, Gatewood still wants to destroy William Curry (Mike Hagan), the man responsible for his brother's death. As Gatewood involves the entire town in his bitter feud with Curry, both men's daughters (Jennifer Rouse and Kelly Potchak) find themselves caught in the middle.
link.title: synopsis
Shoot First and Pray You Live
The Gambler, the Girl and the Gunslinger
The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

link.synopsis: In the final installment of the "Sometimes They Come Back" trilogy (based on a Steven King short story) military officers Capt. Sam Cage (Clayton Rohner) and Maj. Callie O'Grady (Chase Masterson) are sent to a CIA outpost in Antarctica to investigate some mysterious deaths. They discover that a crazed base employee with demonic power is killing his co-workers. Faith Ford and Brian Shebanski co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Wishmaster 3: Beyond the Gates of Hell
Mari-Cookie and the Killer Tarantula / Incubus
WC: Bandana Swangin: All That Glitters Ain't Gold
I Know What You Did Last Summer
Dust Devil: The Final Cut: Work Print

link.synopsis: Four Texans working in a Mexican restaurant on the San Antonio Riverwalk believe they're on the verge of discovering the centuries-old treasure of the legendary Tejano folk hero, Gregorio Cortez. Convinced that he's a descendent of the noble Cortez, Jesse (Jesse Borego) uncovers some old family papers and discovers a disturbing secret … as well as a map to the lost treasure.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A group of crazy bikers meets up with a group of drug-addicted hippies against the backdrop of a minimally populated town, creating chaos for the small locale. Seemingly made for each other, the two roving factions are soon at odds, unable to coexist as their overpowering, careless perspectives incessantly clash. Co-stars Gary Busey and Scott Glenn.
link.title: synopsis
Biker Babylon / Rebel Rousers / The Wild Ride
The Young Racers / The Wild Angels
Bring Me the Head of Alfredo Garcia

link.synopsis: Two comical toys named Peepers and Zoom are on a journey of discovery ... to trace their roots. Encouraged by their young owner and a wise old toy, Peepers and Zoom embark on a fascinating odyssey that eventually takes them back to their beginnings -- a factory in Japan (what a surprise!). This offbeat yet enchanting story springs from the imagination of Ted Thomas, the son of veteran Disney animator Frank Thomas.
link.title: synopsis
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
Sesame Street: Play-Along Games and Songs
The Adventures of Raggedy Ann & Andy: The Mabbit Adventure
Adventures of the Gummi Bears: Vol. 1: Seasons 1-3
Harry the Dirty Dog...and More Terrific Tails
Kidsongs: A Day with the Animals
Kidsongs: A Day at the Circus
The Lion King: Circle of Life: Sing-Along Songs
The Adventures of Elmo in Grouchland
The Last Flight of Noah's Ark
The Looney, Looney, Looney Bugs Bunny Movie
Tommy Tricker and the Stamp Traveller
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
Baby: Secret of the Lost Legend
My Little Pony and Friends: The End of Flutter Valley
Josh Kirby, Time Warrior: Trapped on Toy World
Hello Kitty Goes to the Movies

link.synopsis: Based on Peter Mayle's best-selling book, this animated sex-education video for youngsters is perfect for their anxious parents, too. Comedian Howie Mandel narrates as the video chronicles human reproduction from conception through childbirth in a humorous, gentle manner, answering the embarrassing questions that parents often find hard to discuss. The facts of life are explained in straightforward terms using anatomically correct sketches.
link.title: synopsis
Sesame Street: Play-Along Games and Songs
The Care Bears Movie II: A New Generation
The Adventures of the American Rabbit
Kidsongs: A Day with the Animals
In Search of a Golden Sky
Harry the Dirty Dog...and More Terrific Tails
Baby: Secret of the Lost Legend
Mighty Mouse: The New Adventures: The Complete Series
The Real Ghostbusters: Creatures of the Night
Ultraman II: The Further Adventures of Ultraman
Kidsongs: A Day at the Circus

link.synopsis: Irish television network RTE has delved deep into its archives to garner this showcase collection of musical and dance performances originally aired on Irish TV from 1961 to 1986. Jigs, reels, hornpipes, step and ceilidh dances, solo performances and showstopping musical extravaganzas -- it's all here. Featuring some of traditional Irish music's best-known acts, this anthology is sure to please even the most discerning folk music enthusiast.
link.title: synopsis
From Clare to Here: Irish Music at Home and Abroad
The Chieftains: Down the Old Plank Road
Celtic Thunder: From the Original Producer of Celtic Woman
Gaelic Spirit: Bringing Together the Best in Irish Music
Loreena McKennitt: Nights from the Alhambra
Out of Ireland: Story of Emigration into America
The Best of Daniel O'Donnell on Film
Dublin City Ramblers: Favorite Irish Folk Songs
Jim Macleod: Hogmanay Party from Blair Castle
Alexander Bros: Scotland We Love You
The Corrs: The Best of the Corrs
Everton Blender: Live in Berkeley, CA
Sikkil Gurucharan: Live Recording Music Season 2007
Cultura Profetica: Tribute to the Legend Bob Marley
Savai Gandharva Music Festival, Pune 2007: Pandit Jasraj
Savai Gandharva Music Festival, Pune 2007: Pandit Bhimsen Joshi: Vol. 2
Black Uhuru with Sly & Robbie: Dubbin' it Live

link.synopsis: Filmmaker Chris Marker lends his unique talent for montage to this portrait of French photographer Denise Bellon. Marker uses Bellon's work to reveal Paris, Europe, the world, art and cinema as they were from 1935-55. As unconventional as its director and its subject, the film uses a nonlinear approach to mimic human memory as it examines Bellon's life, family and travel throughout the world. Bellon's daughter Yannick co-directed this documentary.
link.title: synopsis
The Case of the Grinning Cat
William Eggleston in the Real World
Art 21: Art in the Twenty-First Century
In the Realms of the Unreal
Science Is Fiction: 23 Films by Jean Painlevé
The Documentaries of Louis Malle: Vive Le Tour / Humain, Trop Humain / Place de la Republique
What Remains: The Life and Work of Sally Mann
Vito Acconci: In Conversation at Acconci Studio, New York
Matisse/Picasso: Twin Giants of Modern Art
Henri Langlois: Phantom of the Cinematheque
Artists of the 20th Century: Alberto Giacometti
Artists of the 20th Century: Paul Klee
Artists of the 20th Century: Piet Mondrian
Artists of the 20th Century: Marc Chagall
Superstar: The Life and Times of Andy Warhol
13 Most Beautiful... Songs for Andy Warhol's Screen Tests
The Hypothesis of the Stolen Painting / The Suspended Vocation

link.synopsis: Director Giorgio Diritti helms this riveting drama that follows the increasingly urgent plight of a sleepy Italian farming village when German soldiers occupy the surrounding territory during World War II. As civilians cling to a semblance of ordinary life, underground partisan attacks and Nazi reprisals sweep the town into a vortex of brutal violence. Maya Sansa, Alba Rohrwacher and Claudio Casadio star.
link.title: synopsis
Saint John Bosco: Mission to Love
Adored: Diary of a Porn Star
The Night of the Shooting Stars

link.synopsis: Alfredo B. Crevenna's racy romantic farce centers on a group of middle-aged men and woman whose blossoming relationships are interrupted when all of the males inexplicably develop a strange itch that interferes with their love life. Crevenna's standout cast includes Carmen Salinas, Charly Valentino, Guillermo Rivas, Jesús González Leal, Rebecca Silva and Claudia Guzmán.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When Flora Poste (Kate Beckinsale), a young society woman in 1930s London, becomes suddenly orphaned, she's forced to take up residence with a group of her unsophisticated, oddball relatives at their farm. Despite protests from the bedridden, iron-willed matriarch of the farm, the aspiring lass tries to achieve some semblance of order and class in the house -- and in her own life. Cast also includes Eileen Atkins, Ian McKellen and Joanna Lumley.
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie

link.synopsis: Patricia Heaton ("Everybody Loves Raymond") hosts a night of Christian stand-up comedy all-stars. From the producer of Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie, this is a rib-tickling collection of good clean fun. Featured routines are presented by world-class comics such as Thor Ramsey, Jeff Allen, Teresa Roberts Logan, Gilbert Esquivel and Taylor Mason. No topic is off limits in this answer to comedy lovers' prayers.
link.title: synopsis
Chonda Pierce: A Piece of My Mind
Ken Davis Live: I'm Not Okay
Best of Mark Lowry & Bill Gaither: Vol. 1
Anita Renfroe: It's Probably Just My Thyroid
Ken Davis: Is It Just Me?
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Incredible Creatures That Defy Evolution: Vol. 1
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
Tess: Looking for My Next Ex-Husband
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Live from the Laugh Factory: Vol. 1
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
Rod Z: I Ain't Lied Yet!
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle

link.synopsis: In Gregg Champion's fish-out-of-water action comedy, Woody Harrelson and Kiefer Sutherland star as modern-day cowboys who ride off into an urban no-man's-land to save their friend Nacho (Joaquin Martinez) and his daughter Theresa (Cara Buono) from an uncertain fate. Together, Sonny (Sutherland) and Pepper (Harrelson) must brave deadly thugs, crowded subways, lusty ladies, pricey hotels -- and each other -- if they're ever going to make it out alive.
link.title: synopsis
Harley Davidson and the Marlboro Man
City Slickers II: The Legend of Curly's Gold

link.synopsis: New York, New York, it's a helluva town! Especially if you're sailors Gene Kelly, Frank Sinatra and Jules Munshin, on leave and ready for fun in New York City in this Oscar-winning musical comedy. But they only have 24 hours in the Big Apple. Gabey (Kelly), Chip (Sinatra) and Ozzie (Munshin) each find romance quickly, and they're going to live every second to the hilt. Tunes include "Come Up to My Place" and, of course, "New York, New York."
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Gene Kelly: Anatomy of a Dancer
Gene Autry Collection: Robin Hood of Texas
The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2

link.synopsis: Martin Lawrence writes, directs, produces and stars in this romantic comedy with bite. Big-time player and club promoter Darnell (Lawrence) does a double-take when a sophisticated beauty named Brandi (Lynn Whitfield) catches his eye at the club. But as he tries to win her over, the prize is far from what he expected. When Darnell decides he'd rather be with an old friend (Regina King), Brandi won't take the hint -- she's ready to get even.
link.title: synopsis
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Teen dreams Freddie Prinze Jr. and Julia Stiles star in this college-age romantic comedy. When uptight upperclassman Alfred (Prinze) and free-spirited undergraduate Imogen (Stiles) meet, they prove opposites attract. The twist? The story is narrated from both points of view. Henry Winkler and Lucy Arnaz tackle the parental roles, but it's Prinze's and Stiles' winning performances that elevate Down to You.
link.title: synopsis
Jack and Jill vs. the World
I Love You, I Love You Not
The Prince & Me 2: The Royal Wedding

link.synopsis: English playboy Alfie (Michael Caine) is a charming Don Juan in the free-spirited 1960s with an insatiable appetite for women. He lives for sex and steers clear of emotional attachments, taking up with one "bird" after another. But his carefree days are over when he impregnates multiple women … and discovers one of them is married. This Golden Globe-winning comedy boasts a cool jazz score that's as smooth as the title character.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: The Man Who Would Be King
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie

link.synopsis: Part mystery and part comedy, this film tackles the origins of the world's most famous detective, Sherlock Holmes. Here, Holmes is depicted as an invention of Dr. John Watson (Ben Kingsley), who acts as if Holmes really exists. But when Holmes's popularity grows, Dr. Watson finds himself inundated with requests for detective service. In need of help, Dr. Watson hires a bumbling local actor (Michael Caine) to masquerade as the great detective.
link.title: synopsis
Agatha Christie Classic Mystery Collection: A Caribbean Mystery
The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie
Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear
The Man Who Would Be King

link.synopsis: Comedian Richard Pryor may have multiple sclerosis, but as the title of this eponymous disc says, he ain't dead yet. And he invited a few friends -- including Dave Chappelle and Jamie Foxx -- to celebrate that fact. Whoopi Goldberg, D.L. Hughley and George Lopez also witness Pryor as he plays host for the get-together, which originally aired on Comedy Central and features clips of his concert appearances, recordings and excerpts from his diary.
link.title: synopsis
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life is Calling
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
We Don't Die, We Multiply: The Robin Harris Story
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair

title.regular: Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!! Uncensored
title.short: Richard Pryor: I Ain't Dead Yet #*%$#@!!

link.synopsis: Van (Clark Gable) is happily married to Linda (Myrna Loy) but can't survive in business without his loyal secretary, Whitey (Jean Harlow). The plot thickens when Van takes Whitey on a business trip, fueling Linda's jealousy and infuriating Whitey's boyfriend (James Stewart, in one of his first roles). The stars of this little-known MGM 1930s screwball comedy directed by Clarence Brown all play against type to great effect.
link.title: synopsis
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
You Can't Take It with You
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Abe Klein (Andrew Lee Potts), an unassuming American living in London, finds himself in a life less ordinary when he accidentally switches cell phones with a high-strung hit man (Gary Oldman) and is forced to take all the assassin's calls. Abe's odyssey of mistaken identity brings him in striking distance of a crazy lot of underworld characters played by Robert Carlyle, Terence Stamp and Billy Zane in this zany black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels

link.synopsis: With startling candor and searing wit, provocative funnyman Bill Maher shares his take on such hot topics as health-care reform, the Great Recession, racism, right-wing patriots, U.S. troops in the Middle East and Michael Jackson. Recorded live at the Raleigh Memorial Auditorium, this Emmy-nominated stand-up comedy special also includes pointed jokes targeting former Commander in Chief George W. Bush as well as his successor, President Obama.
link.title: synopsis
Bill Maher: Victory Begins at Home
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart: Indecision 2004
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Lewis Black: Red, White and Screwed
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Dave Chappelle: For What It's Worth
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York

link.synopsis: When international fashion folks head to a major show, their personal and professional lives get out of control … and combustible drama and comedy ensue! This favorite from the 2001 Sundance Film Festival showcases a talented cast and fantastic improvised performances. Among the stars in this ad-libbers' delight are Jeff Goldblum, Paul Sorvino, Mariel Hemingway, Sonia Braga, Peter Gallagher and Rita Wilson.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish

link.synopsis: After her family farm burns down, Sis Hopkins (Judy Canova) arrives in the city to live with her wealthy relatives. Uncle Horace Hopkins (Charles Butterworth) takes Sis under his wing, but snobby cousin Carol (Susan Hayward) can't stand the new addition to the family. Carol plans to humiliate Sis at her sorority, but, unbeknownst to Carol, her country cousin has unexpected appeal. This comedy is based on a play by the same name.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

link.title: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
The Strange Affair of Uncle Harry

link.synopsis: Luscious Britt Ekland stars as Madame Cassandra in this sexy comedy about a trio of nerdy buddies who go to Hollywood to realize their dream of becoming filmmakers, only to wind up chasing the bloodthirsty vampires working in Cassandra's bordello. Although his pals happily submit to the ladies' lust for sex and blood, Kyle Carpenter (Eddie Deezen) is determined to end their wanton ways, even if he has to hide a crucifix in his underwear to do it.
link.title: synopsis
Bachelor Party in the Bungalow of the Damned
The Gore Gore Girls: Special Edition

link.synopsis: BAFTA nominee Jim Dale stars as beloved comedian Spike Milligan in this silly and spirited military comedy based on Milligan's own memoirs about his experiences and mediocre performance as a draftee in World War II. Also featured in the wacky wartime saga are British comedy fixture Arthur Lowe as Maj. Drysdale, the hapless soldier's commanding officer, and Spike Milligan himself playing his own father.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Time I Saw Archie
What Did You Do in the War, Daddy?
Nazi Medicine / The Cross and the Star: Double Feature
Crusade in the Pacific: America at War
Empires of Industry: War Planes of World War II
The Bombing of Germany: American Experience
The Man in the White Suit
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss

title.regular: Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall
title.short: Adolf Hitler: My Part in His Downfall

link.synopsis: Longtime bachelor Skip O'Hara (William Traylor) finally puts away his little black book. But when Skip leaves town on a business trip, his new fiancée, Joanne (Dagne Crane), finds his diary and learns all about his busy romantic life, both before and during their courtship. Director Sandy Howard tells much of this romantic comedy in flashback, revealing that Skip's glamorous playboy lifestyle might not have been as exciting as it looked.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

link.synopsis: When Rosetta Stone (Tilda Swinton), a scientist conducting biological research, has a major breakthrough and writes a paper about it, her colleagues suspect that she's already tested her theories in real-life experiments. Indeed, Rosetta has secretly created three clones of herself, but that's just the tip of the iceberg in this futuristic comedy that puts a hilarious spin on contemporary advancements in science and technology.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Inner Life of Martin Frost

link.synopsis: When they come across an sudden inheritance, small-town store clerk Ernie Finch (Henry Morgan), his wife (Virginia Grey) and her sister (Dona Drake) splurge on a trip to the Big Apple, where they soon encounter some cagey characters who hope to part the wide-eyed bumpkins from their money. But the penny-pinching Finch proves to be a cunning match for even the slickest New York operators. Richard Fleischer directs this delightful comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying

link.synopsis: When dastardly saloon owner Sam Daggett (Frank Jaquet) sabotages Doc Higgins's (Tom Chatterton) efforts to help the community by striking oil, Tucson Smith (Bob Steele), Stony Brooke (Tom Tyler) and Lullaby Joslin (Rufe Davis) ride to the rescue in this installment of the Three Mesquiteers series. Action and comedy combine as Daggett blackmails a local gambler (Dennis Moore) and Joslin dresses as a cleaning lady to collect evidence.
link.title: synopsis
West of Cimarron / Matt Clark, Railroad Detective Meets Crazy Horse
The Gene Autry Collection: Riders in the Sky

link.synopsis: In 2003, Iraqi journalist Yunis Abbas was taken from his home by American soldiers and detained at Abu Ghraib prison on suspicion of planning to assassinate Tony Blair. Only thing is, he was innocent. Through his months-long ordeal played out like a comedy of errors, Yunis learned the true meaning of liberation. His unique story is told via co-director Michael Tucker's footage, Yunis's home videos and illustrations by co-director Petra Epperlein.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Buy: How Tom DeLay Stole Congress
Iraq for Sale: The War Profiteers
Power and Terror: Noam Chomsky in Our Times
Julian Assange: A Modern Day Hero? Inside the World of WikiLeaks
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
Howard Zinn: You Can't Be Neutral on a Moving Train
Outfoxed: Rupert Murdoch's War on Journalism
The Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers
Casino Jack and the United States of Money
Plan Colombia: Cashing in on the Drug War Failure
Stranded: I've Come from a Plane That Crashed on the Mountains
The Conspiracy to Rule the World: From 911 to the Illuminati
Mr. Death: The Rise and Fall of Fred A. Leuchter Jr.
Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer

title.regular: The Prisoner or: How I Planned to Kill Tony Blair
title.short: How I Planned to Kill Tony Blair

link.synopsis: When rural handyman and willful curmudgeon Flagg Purdy (Alan Arkin) accuses his friendly rival Gus Falk (Austin Pendleton) of cheating at checkers, the conflict escalates, and Flagg takes Gus to court. Flagg's actions create bad blood in the community, causing neighbors to shun him until he finally climbs into his "deathbed" and calls on his six children to pay their respects. Glenne Headly and Lauren Holly co-star in this charming comedy-drama.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Peter Bogdanovich directs this homage to the great musical comedies of the 1930s about three couples that meet, fight, sing and eventually fall in love in New York. A playboy (Burt Reynolds) woos a singer (Madeline Kahn), an heiress (Cybill Shepherd) meets a gambler (Duilio Del Prete) and the playboy's valet (John Hillerman) falls for the heiress's maid (Eileen Brennan) in this song-and-dance extravaganza featuring music by Cole Porter.
link.title: synopsis
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
